website_summaries.verdict: The response towards the Salomon Speedcross 4 GTX was mostly satisfactory. Many felt that it worked responsibly on the trails and that it was truly able to deliver reliable service, even when exposed to different types of weather conditions. The general quality of this neutral shoe didn’t disappoint the trail runners. But some had a few gripes about how their feet felt when wearing it. They also noticed the steep price tag.
pros: The durability of the Salomon Speedcross 4 GTX was lauded by many testers
they wrote that it lasted a long time, even when used frequently on the trails
The lacing system gained some fans
runners commented that they were easy to adjust and manipulate
Many consumers felt that the upper was able to wrap around their feet snugly, just like a glove
For a number of testers, this shoe looked cool and modern
The waterproof mechanism that’s present in this shoe received acclaim because runners felt that it adequately protected their feet from water
A great number of testers commented that the sizing schemes of this shoe were able to follow their preferences
Many purchasers were able to use this running shoe during the winter season, and they reported that it stayed efficient, even when trudging through snowy surfaces
The cushioning system was reliable, according to those who have tried it
A reviewer stated that the sole unit kept the foot well-cushioned, even when traversing more aggressive surfaces
The outsole’s gripping capability didn’t disappoint those who have used the Salomon Speedcross 4 GTX
cons: Runners quickly took note of this running shoe’s expensive price
The toe box was uncomfortably narrow, reported a tester
It ran a bit wide for a tester, and they noted that it was the reason they did not feel a glove-like fit

customer_reviews.title: Great trail shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I like these for trail and general use. Good snug fit and novel lacing system which makes them easy to get on and off. Do not feel quite as breathable as they could but this is expected if you want shoes that are fully waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: M V A Forte

customer_reviews.title: Great trail running shoe
customer_reviews.text: I've tried many trail running shoes over the past few years and these are by far the best I've owned. Really good grip, waterproof and really comfortable. I run at least twice a week often in muddy conditions, hosing my shoes off at the end of each run, and they look like new after months of wearing them. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Tight across the toes
customer_reviews.text: They look great, are easy to get on and off and I like the idea of not having laces. The only drawback for me is that after wearing them for a couple of hours they start to hurt my toes. The length fits great but they could do with being slightly wider at the toes for my feet and this is not an issue I generally have when buying shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and a nice size
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shoe, great grip for muddy conditions. Hopefully the Goretex lining will last, as this is often the Achilles heal of Gore-tex lined trainers. I have high foot arches and could do with a slightly higher instep.
customer_reviews.author: M. Amiss

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant shoes, grip on loose or wet ground is perfect, best trail shoes I've ever had
customer_reviews.author: Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Great for outdoor activity under wet conditions
customer_reviews.text: I use it for cycling and hiking, including in very wet conditions and it does the job well. I do recommend to get a size bigger, since it is a bit smaller than I was excepting. All in all, I am very pleased with the shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Tal Eretz-Kdocha

customer_reviews.title: Top notch
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic shoes great colour perfect for running and walking my dog through the woods and trail running loads of grip super comfortable and responsive and they keep your feet dry
customer_reviews.author: Mighty Mike

customer_reviews.title: Thanks
customer_reviews.text: Perfect very happy as they said it might be 28th of April delivered in three days awesome thank you
customer_reviews.author: James Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Great comfort
customer_reviews.text: The size is spot on. They are incredibly light and have amazing grip. Really impressed with the overall product and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Sizing wrong, too small
customer_reviews.text: Had a pair of these shoes that I loved but needed replacing. The new pair were too small so ordered a bigger size but they were too big. Disappointing as the shoes tick all the boxes
customer_reviews.author: Joanne

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Value for money. Comfortable fit. Well supported and soft soles. You’ll need to go half a size up from your usual size though.
customer_reviews.author: Graham Lines

customer_reviews.title: Excellent but consider sizing
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, I have another pair of mid shoe salomons and as always the quality is unrivalled. Delivery was on time. I would recommend ordering a half or full size up. I am a uk 9/43 normally, needed to go up to 9.5/44 to get a comfortable fit
customer_reviews.author: Matt H

customer_reviews.title: Great trainer - light, comfortable, properly waterproof
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent trainers. Broke them in with an 11km run in driving rain - I was soaked, but my feet stayed bone dry. Very light, very grippy, really comfy to run in. They have great arch support and stiff inserts - I over-pronate when running and this can cause pain and injury, but these trainers correct well for that. When I bought them they were at a sale price (around half the RRP) and they are great value for that price - you can tell they will stand up well and last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: SiCon

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and kept my feet dry...for a while
customer_reviews.text: I bought my shoes last October (19th) and was so impressed with the fit and how dry they kept my feet through the harsh winter, that I bought a pair for my husband. I walk/run everyday, regardless of weather. However, although they were great for about 8 months, they upper fabric started to deteriorate. I've worn them, with the worn fabric, through the dry months but am having to buy a new pair (today, actually) as they take in water. They only lasted about 8 months. On the subject of sizing - definitely a good idea to go up half a size.
customer_reviews.author: Zizzi

customer_reviews.title: Specialist cross-country shoe for mud and wet conditions
customer_reviews.text: I do parkruns on a local course that is notoriously muddy and hilly. I wanted the best shoe to stop ne slipping around and researched hard to find one. This came out top and thoroughly deserves it. I have never run up a muddy hill with such confidence before. The grip is fantastic, and puddles are no problem either. But this is really a specialist shoe to these sort of conditions - I'd hesitate to use them on concrete or tarmac paths. The only downside is the sizing, which is small. I went a full size larger and even then they are tight - and especially narrow.
customer_reviews.author: John Birch

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I first bought the Speedcross 4 shoes after being recommended by a friend when I started trail running. They are great trainers and very shortly after bought the waterproof version (gtx) to use for dog walking. I buy a half size bigger as they are quite small in size. I would recommend these to anyone even as a day to day trainer. If I was going to find fault I’d say the tread started to wear away slightly quicker than expected but to be fair they were never off my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Barkham

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic on muddy trails and off road
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic on muddy paths / trails / Fields, 2nd pair off these, I simply destroyed the old pair, went with the GTX version as I brought this at start of winter, hard decision if GTX or not as nothing is waterproof once the water gets to your ankles. They are an off road trail shoe, and do offer excellent grip in mud and soft ground, on the reverse they are not a road shoe and more than a couple of miles on a road and it becomes jarring.
customer_reviews.author: tony

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Running Shoe for all conditions
customer_reviews.text: 1st time buying Salomon shoes, I regularly run 5-10km in parkrun / tough mudder etc - this shoe can do it all. No issues on slippery surfaces as the lugs grip in soft ground. Cushioned sufficiently for running on roads though more at home trail running offroad, or in wet conditions. The easy lace toggle provided is much easier than trying to undo tightly tied laces after a hard run. Very happy and will be sticking with this brand in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: A good investment and happy feet!
customer_reviews.text: Had these a few weeks. These are simply great. I don’t often give five stars but, currently, these are worth it. I wasn’t sure about the lacing set up on them but I have to admit it is easy and quick to use. They are also light in weight and fit perfectly. No rubbing or chafing. And, no blisters! I did a twelve mile nonstop walk with no problems whatsoever. This is my first pair and when they wear out I’ll be buying some more again. I’ve had other Salomon shoes and they too have been good. So far, I cannot fault them.
customer_reviews.author: Kev Billington

customer_reviews.title: EXQUISITE COMFORT,STYLE AND PROTECTIVELY ROBUST TRAIBERS
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and stylish running shoes. Excellent fir running and walking as I discovered. Personally,I,have wide feet with bunions so I bought nine and half size and use shoe stretcher in between wearing the trainers to continually stretch the trainers . The trainers would otherwise have fitted snuggly if I did not have wide feet with bunions.
customer_reviews.author: Kendo

customer_reviews.title: Good fit and finish - would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Used for domestic perambulation only, in time for winter (If I wanted to cross a muddy field I’d have bought an old Defender). The extra knobblies take a bit of getting used to, but good grip, good fit, good value, typical Salomon stuff really. Not had a chance to put the GTX to the test,, but am expecting similar performance to my last pair, which were fine.
customer_reviews.author: Richyrich

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using them every day for some months now. They are very light, quite comfortable and they do well what they are made for. However, they are not waterproof. If you run or walk on wet grass or off road your feet very quickly get wet. Let alone if it’s raining... They are great only for running/walking on dry terrain.
customer_reviews.author: Y

customer_reviews.title: Buy a size bigger and you’re all set
customer_reviews.text: These are small for their sizing. I can endure them with my thinnest running socks but it’s still a squeeze. They do seem to stretch a bit after a while but I don’t enjoy them as much as I should because of that. Other than that I really like them so just go up a size for the best fit.
customer_reviews.author: Heavy Surf

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended winter 'off road' running shoe
customer_reviews.text: My favourite trainers for the winter (I'd wear them year round if the knobbles weren't so aggressive) I run all through winter in these and in some of the wettest sloppiest muddy conditions and they grip like glue, never let water in.....are super easy to fasten due to the quick lace Are supportive and are super comfy I'll buy another pair when they wear out (and then I'll use them as summer trainers with smaller knobbles)
customer_reviews.author: Paul Grocott

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of trail shoes
customer_reviews.text: Probably 1/2 size too small, or need breaking in more, a bit tight on my toes compared to my regular NB running shoes. Good waterproofness have kept my feet dry whilst fell running and no blisters. I love the colour! Great price as these were on discount since the 5’s have come out.
customer_reviews.author: Art_izan

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: These are the second pair Salomon shoes I've bought and although slightly more expensive (although you can get them for a good price if you shop around) they are good value for money. Had these for a couple of days and have done a two X country runs so far and they are great. Good fit against the size chart, generates great traction in the mud and uneven surfaces that I run on both up and down hill. I look forward to many more stressless miles in these super shoes.
customer_reviews.author: D A Wiggins

customer_reviews.title: Great. But not for hard surfaces
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to run a mixture of road and trail as the route involves both. They are brilliant on the trails in thick mood with little grip lost and virtually no slip. They are light and comfortable. But the tall rubber lugs do not fare well on hard road/pavement surfaces and get shredded to bits after only a few runs.
customer_reviews.author: Peter B.

customer_reviews.title: forgot how narrow they are.
customer_reviews.text: yup- much like Doc martens.... by the time there comfy there finished... I'd forgotten. Doh! repeat, repeat, repeat,... buy Merell. buy Merell. buy Merell Duck foot. It's like Hobbit v Elf... Your never going to be an Elf. just be comfy. Even if your a Lass and you buy a blokes size thinking it will be cut wider- just don't. It isn't. Just buy something else. annoying.
customer_reviews.author: jude

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Speed cross 4’s are an annual purchase for me .. the pro’s are , fantastic arch support & good degree of water resistance. I can exceed 20K steps in a day or jog in these and have no arch pain. The only negatives of these are: I use them in the workplace and they tend to not have a very hard wearing sole - as such , they get replaced annually. Worth every penny though & the 1yr life span is likely owed to my using them in an industrial workplace where there are abrasives and chemical exposure. 5Star product.
customer_reviews.author: Scott-c85

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: Should have gone larger - compared with various Inov8 trail shoes I have worn these are noticeably smaller - and the effect is exacerbated by the hard rubber toes. Would have sent them back if the dog hadn't shredded the packing they came in. I've replaced the insoles with something thinner and will make do. Plan to update the review after using them on wet muddy trails for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Good quality trainers, just be aware they have spikes on the bottom
customer_reviews.text: Good quality Salomon trainers, my favourite brand in recent years, just be aware they have spikes on the bottom so no use for roads/ harder surfaces, great for running in mud though.
customer_reviews.author: Fantatsictoast1

customer_reviews.title: Good fit (half size up) and v comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of trail / mud shoes. I own the non - GTX version and this GTX version. Both pairs, I bought half size larger than my normal shoe size and both are fine, but this (GTX) version is more comfortable. I think that the toe box is slightly larger. Very waterproof. Proven running through icey, dew-y knee high grass and only ingress was through the big hole at the top!
customer_reviews.author: Timmy

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Trail Running/Walking Shied
customer_reviews.text: I had Salomon waking shoes before these and they had been used for fell walking, Dog walking, any and every walking. They are a brilliant shoe and Gore Tex keeps you completely dry. They needed replacing so bought the SpeedCross 4 and they are lighter, a great fit and better traction (I want to get into trail running which is why I changed to these) Only thing to say is go half a size up from what you would normally wear, saves returning and changing them, seems to be standard for Salomon shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Conley

customer_reviews.title: Great Running/Walking Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Had these for just over a week now - done about 40 miles thus far. Finding them to be a really comfortable fit - straight from the box. They are certainly a snug fit, and I am glad that I listened to other reviews and went for a half size bigger than I normally buy, but it is a really comfortable fit and I feel very secure while running on unpredictable ground. I like the lace system - very easy to use and having just been on a wet run this morning, can confirm that they keep your feet dry! So overall, really very pleased with these shoes thus far, would certainly recommend based upon experience to date.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Small
customer_reviews.text: Terribly small sizing, I’ve worn size 9 shoes for 30 years and never had a pair so small, big toe jammed against the unforgivingly firm toecap and smaller toes scrunched together. Alright for a brief wander but doesn’t seem like they would open up much and running would result in injury.
customer_reviews.author: J. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Robust and comfy, ordered size up.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a size up (usually a 42) and this works great. Quick delivery and good value - stylish shoe. I use these to jog on sand (compacted and soft, or dry and wet) , briefly through water at times, over rock, stones and soil and they are holding up well so far over this summer (2018). The odd time used on pavement also. Pleased.
customer_reviews.author: artalis

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: Really comfy, well made, a touch smaller than NIKE in size but maybe not even half a size..... I ordered my proper size and they are snug but they fit. Make sure you know there is a difference between gtx models a lot look identical, one is waterproof (gtx) and one is not!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy user
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my boyfriend as he needed waterproof shoes while walking our two pooches in muddy farm tracks. He says that these are the most comfortable shoes he’s ever had and he is using these pretty much every where. Probably need to buy a new pair for him, since the bottom of the shoe wears off quite wuickly on hard surfaces. However this is fine, since these are originally meant for trail running. Gore-tex doing it’s work keeping the moisture and mud out of the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Heini

customer_reviews.title: £140 for 4 months wear - disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I really loved these trainers, genuinely I did, however, I have to be honest, after 4 months I had absolutely no tread left on the heels or the balls of my feet. I spent £140 on these trainers for 4 months of wear. I’m not a serious runner, I made it to week 4 on c25k, I walk my dog and that’s about it. 4 months they lasted. I’ll let you decide whether you think they are worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Lianne Jones

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Gutted love the shoes on my fifth pair they’ve worn out and split after only five months I really hoped to get more out of that normally get a year very disappointed and now the price has gone up £15 for a new pair
customer_reviews.author: James Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Not the same as before!
customer_reviews.text: Sent these back as they were to small and narrow, i wouldn't mind but i ordered 1 size larger. This model seems to have reduced in size so i won't be purchasing anymore.
customer_reviews.author: DJ Hause

customer_reviews.title: Lovely trainer
customer_reviews.text: I um-ed and ah-Ed about these for ages. Kept looking at reviews. Finally bought some. Very narrow fit, unfortunately had to send back. Bought the Salomon Sppedcross Vario GTX instead, better fit.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Phillip Aldred

customer_reviews.title: saloman size 7.5
customer_reviews.text: recently bought these, only worn a few times so far but seem to be comfortable enough, im a size 7 & got a 7.5 due to buyers saying to order a half size up & they fit just fine, i don't like the lacing system but thats just a personal thing
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dry feet! 😃
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shoes for the outdoors. Keep your feet dry and have excellent treds for going off the beaten track. Very comfortable as well, definitely worth a perchase.
customer_reviews.author: aikido74

customer_reviews.title: Great Footware!
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable, I use them as walking shoes / casual shoes and they are fine. I order a 1/2 size bigger than my size as recommended in the reviews and they fit perfect. Very happy with these
customer_reviews.author: Darron Hillier

customer_reviews.title: I love it... but it is a challenge to get the right size
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. The only problem is to get the right size, because it seems they number them according to no standards! I had to order 3 Salomon trail shoes to get something close to my need (I kept the ones which are full UK size bigger shoe, and still I think it would have been better a half size bigger shoe)
customer_reviews.author: Fviajero

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe but one has split already (275km)
customer_reviews.text: This is a superb trail shoe - loads of grip and good support. However after only 275km one of them has split around the toe crease. Not happy - they should be good for well over 600km. And I can't find any information on how to seek a refund/replacement.
customer_reviews.author: MTL

customer_reviews.title: Versatile hill and mountain wheels!
customer_reviews.text: Quality trail trainers and very versatile. From muddy woods, going up the hills or a Scramble up a mountain these have you covered for the lot! One of the best about.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Great Service / Speed
customer_reviews.text: I bought these trainers as a present and the service and speed of receiving the trainers was great. The recipient is a size 10, so i originally ordered a size 10, however feedback from the recipient was that these were slightly too tight so I returned and re-ordered for a size 11 instead. No issues at all with the return and refund of the size 10 trainers and again speed of service was great.
customer_reviews.author: M Kempthorne.

customer_reviews.title: Go half a size up
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes for heavy trail or OCR but you need to go half a size up at least unless you want mashed toes and missing toenails. The lacing system takes a bit of getting used to and can be a bit painful/fiddly when you've freezing cold hands that have been ripped to pieces by the evilness of the rigs at a race.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Housley

customer_reviews.title: Not durable and warranty worthless
customer_reviews.text: The sole detached from the shoe after 6 months use. Salomon said this was the consequence of normal wear and tear and therefore not applicable for replacement under warranty. Having worn a number of shoes in my time, this is the first occasion that I've seen a sole fall off after such a short period. If that can really be considered 'normal wear and tear', and not a manufacturing defect, then these shoes are simply not manufactured to an adequately durable standard. Would expect much better for the price.
customer_reviews.author: L Smith

customer_reviews.title: GO A SLIGHT BIT BIGGER THAN NORMAL
customer_reviews.text: excellent trainers and super comfy but i was advised to go up a half size prior to buying them and glad i did as they fit perfectly, so if anyone is considering these go a slight bit bigger than normal and you wont be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Scott Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for Tough Mudder event
customer_reviews.text: My Salamon Speedcross arrived very promptly for my Tough Mudder event that weekend. Couldn't have wished for a better shoe which avoiding slipping on what was very wet and muddy terrain. Ordered a half size larger after seeing other reviews and that was a good shout. Only improvement that could be made is on the shoe lace which is too long and required finding some where to place it. Looking forward to using on my Spartan event next weekend now.
customer_reviews.author: Peter R.

customer_reviews.title: They are light and sturdy, a good value shoe
customer_reviews.text: Bought a size 9 thinking they would be a little large, but they were still a bit tight, would suggest you add at least a size bigger. They are light and sturdy, a good value shoe
customer_reviews.author: Gary Smith

customer_reviews.title: Tight toebox
customer_reviews.text: Great for trail running with good grip, unless your trail turns into a wet wooden boardwalk then they become very slippy under foot. Tight fitting toe box for narrow feet, i prefer my shoes with some width so these rub on the side of my toe. Ok for short distance trails but i fear wearing for any distance they might start to annoy my feet. If you like space in the toe box choose something wider. Good shoe for trail
customer_reviews.author: kieran scullion

customer_reviews.title: Great for the job!
customer_reviews.text: These are my second pair of these running shoes - their build quality beats everything else I have tried over the last 30 years. I do off-road and fell type running and the shoes fit the bill perfectly. As with all of the shoes that I have used over the years they wear out pretty quickly, normally the soles disappear and these have been no different. I guess the mileage that I do takes a toll.
customer_reviews.author: karl ayling

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: For me the Best Trail shoes around. Make sure you get the Gore-Tex version though. Keeps your feet dry. I’ve had about 10 pairs. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: theenemywithin

customer_reviews.title: Good Idea but poor quality and aftersales
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of this shoe it fits well and the closure system is great however the sole of one of the shoes detached on one shoe in just 5 months. I have had these shoes before with no issues so I put this down to a unusual quality issue. I returned the shoe to Millets/JD Sports the seller but they said there was no manufacturing fault and refused to exchange . On this basis I can only rate them low as I would expect at least 12 months of usage ( they are used once a week)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: a bit tight
customer_reviews.text: i really like these shoes but a bit disappointed with the size. i have another pair which feel fine - not sure why these are such a problem
customer_reviews.author: loretta & phil

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love these, this is my third pair. I don’t run in them as I prefer a more minimalist running shoe (Salamon Sense Pro) but I use them for hiking and dog walking.
customer_reviews.author: Rob.C

customer_reviews.title: Great if they lasted
customer_reviews.text: My third pair and because the soles don't last. Bought a Christmas already done at the heals.... Great trainers just a bit short lived.... won't be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lennox

customer_reviews.title: Hard to beat the value and the performance in wet and sloppy mud conditions
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace my last pair that had worn out after three years. Hard to beat the value and the performance in wet and sloppy mud conditions
customer_reviews.author: GarethMJ74

customer_reviews.title: Spot on shoes
customer_reviews.text: First time using these shoes and they’re fantastic so far. I’m a cyclist at heart and usually size up with European bike shoes (usually 10, ordered an 11) so did the same with these. Glad I did as the fit is perfect. The lacing system is perfect and makes removing manky shoes a doddle!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Decent but smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: Decent shoes, loving them. Ordered size 11.5, but they're more like 10.5 or 11. When ordering, make sure you pick at least 0.5 bigger size.
customer_reviews.author: Patryk G

customer_reviews.title: Great all round training shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Second pair of Salomon Speedcross bought to replace my original pair which are still going. Used for the gym daily, hiking and for ski holidays keeping feet warm, dry and in comfort. Bought a size larger as they are on the snug size.
customer_reviews.author: Chris A

customer_reviews.title: Narrow fit
customer_reviews.text: They are narrow and have contoured insole, not good for flat feet, had to return
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my walks on the hills etc. Delighted
customer_reviews.text: I must say I am delighted. Beautiful and so well made. Live them. I always suffer from new shoes. For a while. What from these
customer_reviews.author: Ed Tim

customer_reviews.title: Order the next size up
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 9, and having read reviews I tried in store first. having done so, I ordered size ten, which fit well (perhaps a little narrow for some?). Try in store first !!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe but didn’t last as long as hoped
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. Got them for trail runs.. walking the dog etc. Found them a little bit tight on the toes and would likely get a half size up next time. Very comfy. Great grip. Only disappointment is that I found the sole wears fast. Rear part of the sole wore flat in 6-7 months.
customer_reviews.author: Meyket, Hull - England

customer_reviews.title: Great trail shoes with loads of grip and really comfortable. Found true to size fit.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, I ordered a half a size up as the review said, but found these too big. Returning them was easy. And refund very quick. The ordered. My normal size 10. Only done one run so far, this was a trail/ grass hill run over 5k 452m elevation. The shoes has great grip even on the mud and grass and up hill ,Really comfortable with no problems at all. Looking forward to running in these this winter.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. S. J. Harding

customer_reviews.title: NOT GTX AS ADVERTISED
customer_reviews.text: The Salomon Speedcross 4 shoes I ordered were standard not Goretex as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: A Williams

customer_reviews.title: Get a pair in your life 👌
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as my second pair for cross country walking I love them 10/10 for comfort Water proof to an extent All round good trainer for running to
customer_reviews.author: Ryan poole

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 pairs of these (different colours) and 2 other types of their footwear they are great products and would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gregor Robson

customer_reviews.title: Comfy dry feet in wet conditions
customer_reviews.text: Love the colour scheme, and great for running in wet conditions, I really hate wet feet! Interesting lacing mechanism. Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Tone

customer_reviews.title: Great trail shoes
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great. This must be my third or fourth pair. Well built, they take a hammering on any surface, totally waterproof (provided the water hasn't wicked in from your socks :)) and very comfortable. Tying mechanism remains taut throughout life
customer_reviews.author: Geewhiz

customer_reviews.title: great trainer but rubber compound used for the soles are ...
customer_reviews.text: great trainer but rubber compound used for the soles are too soft. The sole has almost worn through within a month of not very intense activity. Whilst the uppers are relatively unmarked.
customer_reviews.author: Alexx50

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Quality shoes, travelled through South America with these as an alternative to hiking boots (waterproof and durable especially around the toes/sole) which i could also use to go jogging with in urban areas (slightly more bulky than normal trainers but still light and comfortable enough). Best investment i made. Was a bit too tight in my normal size so went for half a size larger than my usual shoe size and it fit great.
customer_reviews.author: Tristan Roberts

customer_reviews.title: service excellent would recommend
customer_reviews.text: too small have requested exchange for larger size......i.e. change from 9 to 9.5 hope this will resolve I have yet to have confirmation from you regarding my return ...sent 28/03
customer_reviews.author: a.peplar

customer_reviews.title: brilliant, usual Salomons quality (excellent)
customer_reviews.text: brilliant, usual Salomons quality (excellent). Waterproof, comfortable and easy on/off. Yet another winner from this manufacturer
customer_reviews.author: dean

customer_reviews.title: Stable, grippy and fast
customer_reviews.text: I tried many top selling trail shoes, including the Speedcross 4 and 5 non goretex models and found the GTX 4 the most comfortable, supportive and stable of the lot. Really holds the foot securely without feeling tight, or restrictive. Definitely recommend this shoe to any one looking for a stable, fast and grippy trail shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Quick release shoe lace is very nice. Shoe looks great too, used it for hill running/biking. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Super Shoe great for Walking and Trail Running
customer_reviews.text: Can not fault them suit me fine. Good on off road and on harder surfaces
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pair of trail trainers
customer_reviews.text: Lovely pair of trainers I purchased for my husband. He loves them.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah L Bowler

customer_reviews.title: Quite comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I've just started using this shoes and I find that it's quite comfortable and waterproof for light rain.
customer_reviews.author: Rahul Mourya

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: These are a great product.. I always choose these as my go to trainers.. I highly recommend this brand
customer_reviews.author: Billyb4t

customer_reviews.title: Tough, rugged and most importantly comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: These last me over a year and I give them a pretty tough time .. They aren't cheap, but you get what you pay for ..
customer_reviews.author: pete

customer_reviews.title: Great for mud runs
customer_reviews.text: Great trainers for mud runs or trails. Lots of grip and waterproof
customer_reviews.author: JOP

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Size fitted me perfectly, very comfortable and huge amounts of grip on the ground. Long lace is a bit annoying, that’s my only issue so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Mactavish

customer_reviews.title: Saloman speedcross small fit buy next size upze
customer_reviews.text: Bought a size larger than my normal size as Salomans are usually a small fit.
customer_reviews.author: Xanna

customer_reviews.title: Keep your feet dry and cosy on wintry runs.
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a Christmas present for my son so he stops borrowing mine. Fantastic trainers for running in wet, slippy or rugged terrains.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Great outdoors shoe
customer_reviews.text: All terrain shoes with incredible grip in all surfaces. Be aware this are somehow narrow. For wide feet, move one size up
customer_reviews.author: OriolS

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, solid and waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfy, completely waterproof and good for running or walking. Nice and solid so plenty of support and look good just wearing with jeans. Salomon sizes always seem to come up a bit small so check before you buy.
customer_reviews.author: Allan B.

customer_reviews.title: Very tight fitting
customer_reviews.text: Very narrow fitting, my feet hurt evertime I wear them and my feet are not very broad, disappointed, expensive ornament as can not wear more than half hour, Had high Hope's for these salomon but I will not buy another pair/similar shoe
customer_reviews.author: Andy wilson

customer_reviews.title: Shoe is much smaller than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Show looks great but I could not even fit in to my usual size 10. Shoe looks really tight. A pity because the feel light and durable.
customer_reviews.author: C Sheehan.

customer_reviews.title: Great cross country shoe
customer_reviews.text: Well made shoe ideal for cross country running, grip into dirt to prevent slipping. Waterproof too !
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Unreallll
customer_reviews.text: Brought these for running, gym and football and they are classss! Look no further buy these in a slightly larger size than you normally wear and your golden. Best buy of mine 2020.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Powell

customer_reviews.title: Good fit for my narrow feet and great for Irish ...
customer_reviews.text: Good fit for my narrow feet and great for Irish weather. I'd recommend using scale in centimeters to get the right sizing. Nike 28.5 cm is 9.5 UK, while Salomon states 10. Using this lacing system satisfies the lazy in me while it's not a perfect as normal laces and can create some "hot spots" after a long day. Build quality, grip and looks all top marks. Knocking off a star for missing some comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes ever
customer_reviews.text: Sole degrades fairly quick (I go through a pair per year with almost daily use), but it's an extremely high-quality shoe for trail running or, like me, for every-day use. I never have to worry about tying my shoelaces thanks to its quicklacing system or whether I'm stepping into a deep puddle thanks to Goretex.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes
customer_reviews.text: Good shoes comfortable and working very good in the mood
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. Slightly on the small side. But all Solomon are. So order a bigger size. Love these shoes
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: SALOMON Men's Speedcross 4 GTX Trail Running Shoes Waterproof
product_meta.description: The SpeedCross 4 GTX is an fine shoe for runners who want lightweight and aggressive grip on technical, soft trails. Thanks to the lightweight, waterproof Gore-Tex membrane, you can easily handle the most difficult terrains. Lightness: The lightweight shoe (280 to 330 g) ensures easy comfort even during long workouts. Waterproof: Waterproof Gore-Tex lining to keep your feet dry at all times. Quick and Safe Lace Adjustment: The Quicklace system allows you to tighten the laces quickly and easily, without knots. Fit Management: The Sensifit system cradles the foot ideally, offering a secure and snug fit. Sole: The Wet Traction Contagrip sole is made from smooth and resistant rubber that offers exceptional traction and support for running on wet surfaces.
feature_bullets: Provides excellent cushioning and anatomical support
Molded EVA midsole provides lightweight cushioning and great stability.
